description.narrative: Danish Church Aid - Christmas Calender 2021-2013 - Aminit dreams of going to school. The overall goal of the project is to enable children in target areas of Turkana to access quality education.
FL §06.33.01.11 Other Kinds of Cooperation with NGOs

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: OUTCOME 4: Schools and communities have a conducive and peaceful environment that allows for children and teachers to engage in learning and teaching

Activity 4.1: Establish school peace clubs in areas affected by violent conflict
Activity 4.2: Hold inter-school sports tournaments
Activity 4.3: Hold a sports for peace tournament: Dassenach and Turkana, Turkana and Marsabit
Activity 4.4: Strengthen boundary partners’ engagements through trainings
Activity 4.5: Support community dialogues on resource sharing and dispute resolutions supported by boundary partners
Activity 4.6: Hold interagency meetings on peace building, conflict transformation, culture and harmonious living
Activity 4.7: Support the development and operationalization of resource sharing agreements on fish, lake deltas, water and pasture, including water highlands
Activity 4.8: Support Kraal leaders and peace committee meetings
Activity 4.9: Raise awareness on climate change
OUTCOME 1: Schools have sufficient basic equipment, teaching materials and facilities to provide a quality child friendly learning environment

Activity 1.1: Provide children with scholastic/learning materials
Activity 1.2: Support the development and implementation of School Improvement Plans
Activity 1.3: Improve school sporting grounds and provide sports equipment
Activity 1.4: Train teachers on life skills education
Activity 1.5: Train Teaching Assistants on Combined Activities for Maximized Learning (CAMaL)
OUTCOME 2: Parents/care-givers can afford to pay school fees and actively support their children’s education

Activity 2.1: Support ‘Back to School’ drives and campaigns
Activity 2.2: Engage children as agents of change to draw others (back) to school
Activity 2.3: Support and facilitate positive parenting training and educational radio campaigns to combat child labour
Activity 2.4: Train parents and caregivers on business and financial literacy skills
Activity 2.5: Train parents and caregivers on the VSLA approach and provide follow up support
Activity 2.6: Support to VSLA and other alternative livelihood options for parents and caregivers
OUTCOME 3: Increased household capacity to maintain and improve income, assets, and food security in the face of outside stresses and shocks

Activity 3.1: Provide essential fishing gear
Activity 3.2: Support fishing communities with fibreglass boats and engines
Activity 3.3: Support trainings of fishing groups leaders on fish value chains, marketing and business skills
Activity 3.4: Support Beach Management Unit trainings
Activity 3.5: Improve community farming sites through soil and water conservation
Activity 3.6: Train 30 groups on crop production, agroecology and marketing
Activity 3.7: Provision of farm inputs: seeds and equipment
Activity 3.8: Support small livestock within the Lake grazing areas
Activity 3.9: Identify and train farming community resource persons
OUTCOME 4: Schools and communities have a conducive and peaceful environment that allows for children and teachers to engage in learning and teaching

Activity 4.1: Establish school peace clubs in areas affected by violent conflict
Activity 4.2: Hold inter-school sports tournaments
Activity 4.3: Hold a sports for peace tournament: Dassenach and Turkana, Turkana and Marsabit
Activity 4.4: Strengthen boundary partners’ engagements through trainings
Activity 4.5: Support community dialogues on resource sharing and dispute resolutions supported by boundary partners
Activity 4.6: Hold interagency meetings on peace building, conflict transformation, culture and harmonious living
Activity 4.7: Support the development and operationalization of resource sharing agreements on fish, lake deltas, water and pasture, including water highlands
Activity 4.8: Support Kraal leaders and peace committee meetings
Activity 4.9: Raise awareness on climate change
